author: anagram1964
content: Question, if we want to stake ETH as a validator is there a way to hedge using DeFi so we don't lose if the price of ETH collapses?

author: anagram1964
content: I know this fee market is a long term strategic fix but what do we have in the next 6 months?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!255131692090523665> That question would be better asked in <#598292067260825641> I think.  This channel is about EIP-1559 for Ethereum 1.x.

author: timbeiko
content:
> EIP-1559 and Escalators: Fixing the Ethereum Fee Market: In just under 24 hour‚Äôs time, <@!552133098075193354>  is going to present at the Ethereum Engineering Group meet-up about EIP 1559 and other contenders. 
> To register for this talk: https://www.meetup.com/ethereum-engineering/events/271043146/
To be clear, the talk is aimed at people _not_ familiar with EIP-1559. If you're hanging out here, you probably know everything I'll cover üòÖ

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!376568077950910466> <@!301186049323958275> re: changes to the spec for FEE_CAP, I think an implementers' call makes sense. I hadn't scheduled one yet because it seemed like many streams of work were in progress and I wanted to wait a bit until we had some "milestones" to report. Maybe late August is what we should aim for?

W.r.t. time zones, is there something that works better for you <@!301186049323958275> ? It seems most folks attending right now are North America or Europe based.
